latestAction.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 643.

item.latestTitle: To facilitate a land exchange involving certain National Forest System lands in the Inyo National Forest, and for other purposes.

latestAction.text: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources Senate Subcommittee on Public Lands, Forests, and Mining. Hearings held. With printed Hearing: S.Hrg. 113-433.

item.title: Inyo National Forest Land Exchange Act
A bill to facilitate a land exchange involving certain National Forest System land in the Inyo National Forest, and for other purposes.
Inyo National Forest Land Exchange Act

bill.title: Inyo National Forest Land Exchange Act

item.name: Public Lands, Forests, and Mining Subcommittee

item.text:
Inyo National Forest Land Exchange Act - Authorizes the Secretary of Agriculture (USDA), in any land exchange involving the conveyance of certain National Forest System (NFS) land within the boundaries of Inyo National Forest in California, to accept the conveyance of certain non-federal land in California outside the Forest boundaries in exchange for the conveyance of the federal land, if acquiring the non-federal land is desirable for NSF purposes.

Authorizes the Secretary to accept a cash equalization payment exceeding 25% of the value of the federal land. Requires the deposit of any such payment into the fund established under the Sisk Act and made available for the acquisition of lands or interests for addition to the NFS.
item.name: Introduced in Senate

committee.name: Public Lands, Forests, and Mining Subcommittee

item.text: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources Senate Subcommittee on Public Lands, Forests, and Mining. Hearings held. With printed Hearing: S.Hrg. 113-433.
Read twice and referred to the Committee on Energy and Natural Resources. (text of measure as introduced: CR S9107)
Sponsor introductory remarks on measure. (CR S9106-9107)

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
